newsitem.title: FRANCE: REUTERS FRENCH ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST - AUG 12.
newsitem.headline: REUTERS FRENCH ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST - AUG 12.

text.p: REUTERS FRENCH ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST
News from Reuters and the French press on Advertising, Media & the Internet and Brand-name Products.
ADVERTISING, MEDIA & THE INTERNET:

PARIS - Britain's Virgin Group, aiming to snatch the number two slot from Pepsico's Pepsi Cola in France, is running a series of spoof adverts this month to coincide with the launch of Virgin Cola on the French market.
(Reuter)

LONDON - True North Communications Inc, the U.S.-based advertising holding company, is expanding its global network with a big recent purchase, but is expected to remain on the acquisition trail to further beef up its European presence, industry sources say. (Reuter)

PARIS - Spending on advertising on French television was five percent higher in June 1997 compared to June 1996, a study by Mediacompany says. TF1 had a 51 percent market share, public channels France 2 and France 3 together had 28 percent and M6 had eight percent. (Liberation)

PARIS - Cable television reached 1.55 million homes in France by the end of June, up from 1.4 million a year earlier, a rise of 10.67 percent, the Association of cabled towns says. (Liberation, Le Parisien)
PARIS - Canal Plus says it will broadcast 24 hours a day from September. It currently broadcasts 21 hours a day. (Liberation, Le Parisien)
BRAND-NAME PRODUCTS & MARKETS:

PARIS - The French market for four-wheel-drive vehicles has been less hard-hit than the overall car market, with a fall of 12.7 percent in sales since the start of this year, compared to a slide of 21.2 percent for the overall market. (La Tribune)
PARIS - French consumer prices fell 0.2 percent in July, giving a year-on-year inflation rate of 1.0 percent. (Reuter)

GUATEMALA CITY - State-owned Guatemalan Telephone Company (Guatel) has pre-qualified five telecommunications operators to bid for a stake in Guatel when it is sold to the private sector, company officials say. France Telecom, GTE Corp, MCI Communications Corp, SBC Communications Inc, and Telefonos de Mexico (Telmex) will compete for the sale through their international subsidiaries. (Reuter)

PARIS - Daimler-Benz Interservices (DEBIS) is to buy Cap Gemini's 19.6 percent stake in Debis Systemhaus in a deal which will earn Cap Gemini a 200 million franc ($31.9 million) capital gain, Cap Gemini says.(Reuter)

BRUSSELS - The European Commission says it started a routine probe into a joint venture between Bristol-Myers Squibb of the United States and Elf Aquitaine's subsidiary Sanofi to pool forces in the market for cardiovascular medications.(Reuter)
